Name Rascal/Expressions/Values/Number/abs

Function &T <: num abs(&T <: num n)
Description Absolute value of the number n. The result type is equal to the type of the argument n.
Examples 
rascal>import Number;
ok
rascal>abs(13)
int: 13
rascal>abs(-13)
int: 13
rascal>abs(3.14)
real: 3.14
rascal>abs(-3.14)
real: 3.14
Questions
Question 1.
The type of abs(5) is

Question 2.
The type of abs(-10.425727949230556400) is

Question 3. 
abs(-16) ==

Question 4. 
abs(-5.60625567031345970) ==
